title: How to Draw a Ball Jointed Doll

steps.headline: Draw an oval with guidelines to serve as the head.
steps.description: The guidelines should be vertical for the mouth and nose, horizontal for the eyes and ears. The head itself should have a slightly tapered chin and round skull, as seen.

steps.headline: Sketch the body using geometric shapes.
steps.description: Draw a long, curved line to represent the body's movement, a vertical rectangle for the torso, a horizontal rectangle for the lower body. Sketch straight lines for the hands and legs with circles for joints. Draw rectangles for hands and feet.

steps.headline: Create the shape of the body on the sketched “skeleton."
steps.description: Shape up the face, torso, arms, and legs and draw the ears, hands, and feet following the illustration for reference.

steps.headline: Detail the shape of the body.
steps.description: Add the balls for the joints and make the fingers/toes.

steps.headline: Draw the facial features.
steps.description: Follow the guidelines to draw large, expressive eyes with eyelids, a fine nose, and a small mouth.

steps.headline: Line the drawing with black ink.
steps.description: Try to make a modular line, which passes from a thin to a thick line and vice versa. This will make your drawing look better and more professional.

steps.headline: Color the inked drawing!
steps.description: Erase the pencil and add in color. You're done.

text: Draw an oval with guidelines to serve as the head. The guidelines should be vertical for the mouth and nose, horizontal for the eyes and ears. The head itself should have a slightly tapered chin and round skull, as seen. Sketch the body using geometric shapes. Draw a long, curved line to represent the body's movement, a vertical rectangle for the torso, a horizontal rectangle for the lower body. Sketch straight lines for the hands and legs with circles for joints. Draw rectangles for hands and feet. Create the shape of the body on the sketched “skeleton." Shape up the face, torso, arms, and legs and draw the ears, hands, and feet following the illustration for reference. Detail the shape of the body. Add the balls for the joints and make the fingers/toes. Draw the facial features. Follow the guidelines to draw large, expressive eyes with eyelids, a fine nose, and a small mouth. Line the drawing with black ink. Try to make a modular line, which passes from a thin to a thick line and vice versa. This will make your drawing look better and more professional. Color the inked drawing! Erase the pencil and add in color. You're done.
